derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (as a noun): from medieval Latin dietarium, from Latin diaeta (see diet)

entry.def: You can use dietary to describe anything that concerns a person's diet.

example.ex: Dr Susan Hankinson has studied the dietary habits of more than 50,000 women...
example.tran: 苏珊·汉金森博士对5万多名女性的饮食习惯进行了研究。

example.ex: As with all dietary changes, reducing salt should be done gradually.
example.tran: 像所有改变饮食结构的情况一样，减少盐的摄入量也应当采取渐进的方式。

entry.def: You can use the word dietary to describe substances such as fibre and fat that are found in food.

means.word_mean: 1. of or relating to the diet;

Sentence.sentence: This means that there could be an extra three billion mouths to feed by the end of the century, a period in which substantial changes are anticipated in the wealth, calorie intake and dietary preferences of people in developing countries across the world.
Rising population combined with improved nutrition standards and shifting dietary preferences will exert pressure for increases in global food supply
